Please be advised that the Atlanta Citizen Review Board (‚ÄúACRB‚Äù) has 
concluded its investigation and adjudication of the complaint filed by the male 
complainant alleging that on June 23, 2019, Officer Che Milton (Unique ID #6824) 
engaged in excessive force when he slammed him on the ground causing him to sustain 
injuries to his face.  The complainant also alleged that during the incident, Officer 
Milton was verbally abusive towards him when he called him a ‚Äústupid ass 
motherfucker.‚Äù   
 
The complainant further alleged that Officer James Gikanga (Unique ID 
#7013) abused his authority when he told him that if he filed a complaint against 
Officer Milton, he would arrest him.  
 
Furthermore, it is noted that the investigation also identified Retired 
Investigator Dexter Dumas (Unique ID #0332) as a subject. 
 
 
The Board determined, as it relates to Officer Milton, the following: 
 
1.  The allegation of Excessive Force be assigned a finding of 
Sustained. 
2.  The allegation of Abusive Language be assigned a finding of 
Sustained. 
3.  The allegation of Violation of Department Standard Operating 
Procedures related to the officer‚Äôs failure to complete an incident 
report, as per SOP3010, Section 4.5.2 be assigned a finding of 
Sustained. 
4.  The allegation of Violation of Department Standard Operating 
Procedures related to the officer‚Äôs failure to notify a supervisor after 
using force on Mr. Sanders, as per SOP3010, Section 4.5.7, be 
assigned a finding of Sustained. 
 
The Board is aware that the APD also conducted an investigation into this 
incident and sustained all of the aforementioned allegations.  The Board also 
agreed with the disciplinary action of Termination as the appropriate penalty 
imposed on the officer.

The Board determined, as it relates to Officer Gikanga, the following: 
 
1.  The allegation of Abuse of Authority be assigned a finding of Sustained. 
2.  The allegation of Violation of Department Standard Operating Procedures related to 
the officer‚Äôs failure to notify communications and request a supervisor and/or OPS to 
come to the scene when he determined that the incident involved an off-duty officer, as 
required by SOP2010, Section 4.2.53, be assigned a finding of Sustained. 
3.  The allegation of Violation of Department Standard Operating Procedures related to 
the officer‚Äôs failure to complete and submit an incident report prior to the end of his shift, 
as per SOP3060, Section 4.6.1 and SOP3060, Section 3.4, be assigned a finding of 
Sustained. 
 
 
The Board recommends, as penalty, the officers receives a Written Reprimand and a three (3) 
day suspension for the aforementioned sustained violations.  
 
 
The Board determined, as it relates to Retired Investigator Dumas, the following: 
 
  The allegation of Violation of Department Standard Operating Procedures related to 
the officer‚Äôs failure to have an approved extra job permit from the APD that authorized 
him to work at the incident location as required by SOP.2060, Section 4.2.1 be assigned a 
finding of Sustained and recommends that an Oral Reprimand be imposed as the 
penalty. 
 
The Board further recommends the following: 
 
During his ACRB and OPS interviews, Officer Gikanga alleged that he was not trained to 
handle calls whereby the incident involves a citizen‚Äôs allegation against an officer who 
was already on the scene. Thus, the APD‚Äôs Training Unit should examine this issue and 
provide a response to the Board pertaining to Officer Gikanga‚Äôs claim.

I am in receipt of the Atlanta Citizen Review Board‚Äôs letter regarding the complaint of 
 
 the alleged actions of Atlanta Police Officers Che Milton, James Gikanga, and Investigator 
Dexter Dumas on the 23rd of June 2019, and the Board‚Äôs determination. An investigation by the Atlanta 
Police Department‚Äôs Office of Professional Standards was conducted. This letter serves, in accordance 
with Sec. 2-2213 of the City of Atlanta Code of Ordinances, as a delineation of action taken with respect 
to the Atlanta Police investigation of the event. 
 
The Atlanta Police Department‚Äôs Office of Professional Standards conducted an investigation into the 
incident parallel to the Board‚Äôs investigation. The Office of Professional Standards completed its 
investigation and the three involved personnel were charged accordingly, much like they were by the 
Board with its charges. 
 
Officer Che Milton was charged with violations of Reporting Required When Force Used, Standard of 
Conduct, Conformance to Directives (Extra Jobs), Conformance to Directives (Report Writing), and 
Unnecessary Force. Officer Milton was Sustained on all these violations. Officer Milton was dismissed 
from the Atlanta Police Department for his actions in this incident. 
 
Investigator Dexter Dumas was charged with violations of Conformance to Directives (Extra Jobs), 
Conformance to Directives (Supervisor Notification), and Conformance to Directives (Report Writing).

Investigator Dumas was Sustained on all these violations. He has subsequently concluded his Retired 
Recapture contract position and is no longer employed by the Atlanta Police Department. 
 
Officer James Gikanga was charged with violations of the Unsatisfactory Performance policy and the 
Appropriate Action Required policy. Officer Gikanga was Sustained on both violations. He faced 
suspensions for both violations as discipline.
